WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Nelson Spencer
Address: Carnduff, Sask.
Birthplace: 84 miles from Regina, Ont.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1923
Where did you set up housekeeping? 84 miles from Regina, Ont.
Where had you been living before that? in Ontario
For how many people did you prepare meals? 1
How far was it to your nearest store? 60 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? monthly or quarterly
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? salt, corn meal, flour, cereal

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? quist
In what quantities did you buy it? 25 lb. each
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.50-$2.00
How much did you use Graham flour? 2 lb.
Whole wheat flour? 8-10 hundred
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 60 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 20¢
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? X
Whole wheat? X
Farina? X
Other? cracked wheat
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? at the grist mill
Spencer, Nelson
Garnduff, 1883
